item.title: Efficacy study of glucosamine hydrochloride in bone and joint health
item.dc:creator: pmazzilli_admin_22
item.description:
Which is better, glucosamine hydrochloride or glucosamine sulfate complex salt? In terms of free-base glucosamine (C6H13NO5) content, Glucosamine Hydrochloride (83.1%) has higher content than Glucosamine Sulfate Sodium Chloride (62.5%) and Glucosamine Sulfate Potassium Chloride (59.2%). Many studies have shown that the only biologically active substance among various glucosamine compounds is free-base glucosamine. (Block JA. et […]

The post Efficacy study of glucosamine hydrochloride in bone and joint health appeared first on The Glucosamine Experts™.
item.content:encoded:
Which is better, glucosamine hydrochloride or glucosamine sulfate complex salt?

In terms of free-base glucosamine (C6H13NO5) content, Glucosamine Hydrochloride (83.1%) has higher content than Glucosamine Sulfate Sodium Chloride (62.5%) and Glucosamine Sulfate Potassium Chloride (59.2%). Many studies have shown that the only biologically active substance among various glucosamine compounds is free-base glucosamine. (Block JA. et al., 2010)

Glucosamine sulfate has more clinical effectiveness studies than Glucosamine Hydrochloride. However. in 2006, the European Medicines Agency (EMA) published an Assessment Report on Glucomed625 mg glucosamine hydrochloride , which concluded that there was a favorable risk/benefit ratio for the glucosamine hydrochloride product, on the basis of submitted literature on glucosamine sulfate, as the formulations are not considered to be different in terms of safety or efficacy. Therefore, it can be considered that a precedent was set whereby clinical data for glucosamine sulfate are also applicable to the evaluation of glucosamine hydrochloride. (Bertin P. et al., 2014)

At present, more and more countries in the EU have updated the active ingredient of the marketed glucosamine sulfate & glucosamine hydrochloride medicines to more scientific free-base glucosamine.

The post Efficacy study of glucosamine hydrochloride in bone and joint health appeared first on The Glucosamine Experts™.

item.title: Comprehensive Guide to Global Clinical Research of Glucosamine
item.dc:creator: pmazzilli_admin_22
item.description:
Glucosamine is a high valued, naturally occurring amino sugar, categorized as a nonvitamin and nonmineral dietarysupplement, with demonstrated efficacy for arthritis, neurological disorders, and inflammatory health ailments. Becauseof its diverse industrial applications in food, pharma, and cosmetics, the market demand is expected to exceed 40,000metric tons in 2022. Fill the form to download the file.

The post Comprehensive Guide to Global Clinical Research of Glucosamine appeared first on The Glucosamine Experts™.
item.content:encoded:

supplement, with demonstrated efficacy for arthritis, neurological disorders, and inflammatory health ailments. Because
of its diverse industrial applications in food, pharma, and cosmetics, the market demand is expected to exceed 40,000
metric tons in 2022.

item.title: Complete Guide to the History and Applications of the Supplement Glucosamine
item.dc:creator: pmazzilli_admin_22
item.description:
Glucosamine sulfate tends to rebuild the damaged cartilage, thus restoring articular function in most chronic arthrosic patients. The long-term combined structure-modifying and symptom-modifying effects of glucosamine sulphate suggest that it could be a disease modifying agent in osteoarthritis

The post Complete Guide to the History and Applications of the Supplement Glucosamine appeared first on The Glucosamine Experts™.
item.content:encoded:
Glucosamine sulfate tends to rebuild the damaged cartilage, thus restoring articular function in most chronic arthrosic patients.

The long-term combined structure-modifying and symptom-modifying effects of glucosamine sulphate suggest that it could be a disease modifying agent in osteoarthritis

The post Complete Guide to the History and Applications of the Supplement Glucosamine appeared first on The Glucosamine Experts™.
